channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: I Bought the Pixel 10 and Changed These 10 Settings Right Away
item.dc:creator: Kabir Jain
item.description: I didn’t need new apps or accessories, just a trip to the settings menu.
item.content:encoded: I just got my hands on the Pixel 10, and like always, the first thing I did wasn’t opening the camera or downloading apps—it was diving straight into the settings. Google ships the phone with a bunch of useful stuff turned off by default, and flipping a few of those switches right away makes the Pixel 10 feel faster, smoother, and more “mine.”

item.title: The Long, Slow Push to Make Phones Boot Faster
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: Do you remember how long those old phones took to start?
item.content:encoded: If you booted the original HTC Dream or Samsung Galaxy today, you might feel that it was stuck in a boot loop. Back in the day, Android phones would take a minute or two to start up after a shutdown. Today, phones take seconds to boot up. Let me share the fascinating and clever ways phone makers managed that.

item.title: Turning Off Your Location Doesn't Turn Off Tracking
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: The many, many ways your phone is being tracked with freakish accuracy.
item.content:encoded: Your phone has a location pin toggle in the quick settings slider. You can also find it in the settings app as a toggle labeled location. Turning it off should mean that your phone’s location isn’t being tracked anymore, but even if you turn it off, you’re still being tracked. Let me show you why and how you can make it harder to track your phone.

item.title: Your First Power Tool Purchase Is More Important Than You Think
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Choose wisely, because you're in it for the long haul.
item.content:encoded: Looking to start your DIY journey, just bought a new house, or want to build an arsenal of power tools? You might think it's best to run down to the nearest hardware store and grab any drill, but it's a bigger decision than that. Your first cordless power tool purchase is important because it sets the foundation for your entire tool collection.

item.title: Every iPhone User Should Be Using This Time-Saving Settings Shortcut
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Quickly jump to an app's settings page without navigating any menus.
item.content:encoded: Ever since Apple rearranged the iPhone’s Settings menu, making changes to apps requires a laborious series of taps and swipes. But it doesn’t have to be that way, thanks to a workflow that makes excellent use of Apple’s Shortcuts app.

item.title: The Essential Phone Was Ahead of Its Time
item.dc:creator: Bertel King
item.content:encoded: I covered smartphones during the boom years of the Nexus 5 and the iconic HTC One M7. Then I largely lost interest. I found most smartphones dull—until I laid eyes on the Essential Phone PH-1, a phone that could still turn heads almost a decade later.

item.title: 6 Text Filtering Uses for the Linux awk Command
item.dc:creator: Haroon Javed
item.description: From simple searches to powerful field-based conditions.
item.content:encoded: The awk command is a versatile text-processing tool in Linux. It filters and manipulates files using patterns, conditions, and actions. It supports a wide range of scenarios, making it straightforward to extract specific data from logs, configuration files, or any text file.

item.title: The Deebot X11 OmniCyclone Cleans Like a Champ, But the App Holds It Back
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Why is it so hard to avoid cables?
item.content:encoded: Ecovacs latest Deebot X11 OmniCyclon robot vacuum boasts a slew of new features, but has a similar limitation to many of the other Ecovacs robot vacuums. Is this ultra-premium robot vacuum worth the $1,500 price tag? That depends if you're okay with a few quirks.

item.title: The Ultimate Glossary of Microsoft Excel Symbols
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: You don't truly understand Excel until you know its symbols.
item.content:encoded: Symbols and signs in Microsoft Excel are crucial for data manipulation, data analysis, and high-quality formulas. In this guide, I'll run through all the key symbols (listed alphabetically), explain how you can use them, and show you some examples to make things clearer.

item.title: Why Windows 3.1 Is My Favorite Operating System for My Raspberry Pi
item.dc:creator: Brad Morton
item.description: Windows without the privacy invasions. Or subscription productivity software. Or Social Media.
item.content:encoded: Raspberry Pis are usually associated with light-weight Linux operating systems, like Raspberry Pi OS, but they don't have to. You can use heavy desktop variants, or, if you're feeling especially bold, old versions of Windows. Here's why I've started using Windows 3.1 on my Pi.
